courses.name: MERN
courses.body: MERN is the acronym for MongoDB, Express JS, React JS and Node JS. The MERN stack is a combination of the above technologies, all based on JavaScript, used to build advanced web applications. It is an open source full stack development framework

courses.name: MEAN
courses.body: The MEAN stack is JavaScript-based framework for developing web applications. MEAN is named after MongoDB, Express, Angular, and Node, the four key technologies that make up the layers of the stack.

courses.name: Python
courses.body: Python is an interpreted high-level general-purpose programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability with its use of significant indentation.

courses.name: C++
courses.body: C++ is a general-purpose programming language created by Bjarne Stroustrup as an extension of the C programming language, or C with Classes

courses.name: Android development
courses.body: Android software development is the process by which applications are created for devices running the Android operating system. Google states that

courses.name: Java
courses.body: Java is a high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.
